intro: Selliera rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf selliera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with rounded, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is widely cultivated in Mediterranean climates.
